de.mrapp.android.preference

Class ListPreference

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.preference.Preference
      • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractDialogPreference
        • de.mrapp.android.preference.AbstractListPreference
          • de.mrapp.android.preference.ListPreference
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, java.lang.Comparable<android.preference.Preference>

    public class ListPreference
extends AbstractListPreference
    A preference, which allows to select a value from a list. The selected value will immediately persisted and the preference's dialog will become closed.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ListPreference.SavedState
      A data structure, which allows to save the internal state of a ListPreference.

      • ListPreference

        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.

        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet

      • ListPreference

        public ListPreference(android.content.Context context,
                      android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                      int defaultStyle)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource

      • ListPreference

        public ListPreference(android.content.Context context,
                      android.util.AttributeSet attributeSet,
                      int defaultStyle,
                      int defaultStyleResource)
        Creates a new preference, which allows to select a value from a list.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the preference, as an instance of the class Context
        attributeSet - The attributes of the XML tag that is inflating the preference, as an instance of the type AttributeSet
        defaultStyle - The default style to apply to this preference. If 0, no style will be applied (beyond what is included in the theme). This may either be an attribute resource, whose value will be retrieved from the current theme, or an explicit style resource
        defaultStyleResource - A resource identifier of a style resource that supplies default values for the preference, used only if the default style is 0 or can not be found in the theme. Can be 0 to not look for defaults

      • onPrepareDialog

        protected final void onPrepareDialog(de.mrapp.android.dialog.MaterialDialogBuilder dialogBuilder)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDialogPreference
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog is about to be created. The builder, which is passed as a method parameter may be manipulated by subclasses in order to change the appearance of the dialog.
        Specified by:
        onPrepareDialog in class AbstractDialogPreference
        Parameters:
        dialogBuilder - The builder, which is used to create the preference's dialog, as an instance of the class MaterialDialogBuilder

      • onDialogClosed

        protected final void onDialogClosed(boolean positiveResult)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDialogPreference
        The method, which is invoked on subclasses when the preference's dialog has been closed. This method may be used within subclasses to evaluate the changes, which have been made while the dialog was shown.
        Specified by:
        onDialogClosed in class AbstractDialogPreference
        Parameters:
        positiveResult - True, if the dialog has been close affirmatively, false otherwise
